title: Three Absurdly Cheap Ways to Make Your Child Wealthy
subtitle: Investing Strategies that Generate Massive Wealth for Your Children
content:
Absurdly Cheap Ways to Build Your Child's Wealth

I'm Tyler, a former financial advisor and portfolio manager. Here are three absurdly cheap ways to make your child absurdly wealthy:

1. UGMA Account for Early Investing

Put $100 a week into a UGMA (Uniform Gifts to Minors Act) account. This is a brokerage account for minors, totaling $5,200 a year. Invest in a broad growth ETF like IVW, which has historically returned around 10.5% post-inflation. If you do this from birth until they turn 18, you can stop contributing completely. By age 65, that account should be worth approximately $30.6 million. Your total contributions would be $93,600.

2. Custodial Roth IRA Contributions

Have your teenager work summers or part-time jobs and help them contribute $6,000 a year to a custodial Roth IRA, investing in something like Vanguard's VBK. If they manage this from ages 14 to 18 for only five years, they could have around $2.7 million by retirement, entirely tax-free forever. Your total investment during this period would be just $30,000.

3. Teach Fiscal Responsibility

Raise them to be fiscally responsible. At age 18, encourage them to keep investing in the Roth IRA. From 18 to 65, if they contribute $7,000 annually and invest it in VBK, their final sum at 65 could reach approximately $15.8 million, all 100% tax-free. That's enough to buy a houseâ€”in cash! Or potentially several houses!

Conclusion

All of this wealth could stem from simple tasks like vacuuming your office and smart investment habits. If any of this is helpful, sign up for my free weekly newsletter by clicking the link in my bio. Each week, I'll send you over another money playbook that actually works.
